recipes.title: Lemon-Herb Quinoa & Roasted Veg Bowls
steps: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Cook quinoa in 4 cups salted water until fluffy, 15 minutes; rest covered.
Toss broccoli, tomatoes, onion with 3 tbsp oil, salt, pepper; roast 18–20 minutes.
Whisk remaining oil, lemon juice/zest, garlic, pinch salt.
Toss quinoa with parsley and half the dressing.
Divide quinoa and veg; drizzle remaining dressing.
recipes.chickenPair: Top bowls with sliced baked chicken seasoned only with salt and pepper.
recipes.notes: Keeps 4–5 days. Add lemon wedge when packing.

recipes.title: Smoky Sweet Potato & Chickpea Sheet-Pan Bowls
steps: Heat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Toss potatoes, chickpeas, peppers, onion with oil, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper.
Roast on two sheets, 20–22 minutes, flipping once.
Place spinach into containers; top with hot roast to wilt slightly.
Squeeze lime over portions.
Serve or chill.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken to each bowl.
recipes.notes: Great with a dollop of plain yogurt or tahini.

recipes.title: Cilantro-Lime Black Bean Rice Bowls
steps: Cook rice in 5 cups salted water, 12–15 minutes; fluff.
Toss warm rice with oil, lime juice/zest, cilantro, salt.
Warm beans and corn in a skillet with 2 tbsp water, garlic powder, pinch salt.
Divide rice into containers.
Top with beans/corn and tomatoes.
Add avocado when serving.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced baked chicken on top before serving.
recipes.notes: Pack lime wedges to refresh flavor midweek.

recipes.title: Quinoa Tabbouleh with Lentils & Cucumber
steps: Cook quinoa in 3 cups salted water, 15 minutes; cool 5 minutes.
Whisk lemon juice, oil, salt, pepper.
Combine quinoa, lentils, cucumber, tomatoes, parsley, mint, green onion.
Pour dressing over, toss to coat.
Adjust salt and lemon.
Pack into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken for extra protein.
recipes.notes: Best enjoyed cold; brightens with extra lemon.

recipes.title: Coconut Curry Cauliflower & Spinach
steps: Sauté onion in a large pot with 1 tbsp oil, 3 minutes.
Add garlic, ginger, curry; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in coconut milk, tomatoes, salt; bring to a simmer.
Add cauliflower; simmer until just tender, 10–12 minutes.
Fold in spinach to wilt; season.
Portion over rice or quinoa.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced baked chicken on top of each portion.
recipes.notes: Freezes well; add fresh cilantro when serving.

recipes.title: Greek Chickpea Salad with Feta & Herbs
steps: Whisk oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, pepper.
Combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, olives in a bowl.
Toss with dressing.
Fold in feta.
Pack into containers.
Chill until serving.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken when serving.
recipes.notes: Stays crisp 3–4 days; keep feta separate if preferred.

recipes.title: Zucchini Noodle Pesto with Cherry Tomatoes
steps: Blend basil, garlic, nuts, Parmesan, oil, lemon, pinch salt into pesto.
Sauté zucchini noodles in batches with a little oil, 2–3 minutes to soften.
Toss warm zoodles with pesto.
Fold in tomatoes.
Season to taste.
Portion into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Top with sliced baked chicken for added protein.
recipes.notes: Eat within 3 days for best texture.

recipes.title: Fajita Veggies with Pinto Beans & Corn
steps: Sauté peppers and onions in oil over high heat with chili powder, cumin, salt, 7–9 minutes.
Warm beans and corn with a splash of water and garlic powder; season.
Portion grains into containers.
Top with fajita veg and bean-corn mix.
Add lime wedges if desired.
Seal and chill.
recipes.chickenPair: Add slices of salt-and-pepper baked chicken.
recipes.notes: Pack with salsa or avocado to add day-of.

recipes.title: Tuscan Kale & White Bean Polenta Bowls
steps: Bring broth to a boil; whisk in cornmeal; simmer, stirring, 10–12 minutes until creamy; season and stir in Parmesan.
Sauté garlic in oil; add kale, splash water; wilt 3–4 minutes.
Stir in beans; warm through; season with salt, pepper, chili flakes.
Portion polenta into containers.
Top with kale and beans.
Cool before sealing.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken.
recipes.notes: Reheat with a splash of water to loosen polenta.

recipes.title: Mushroom & Spinach Rice Pilaf
steps: Sauté mushrooms and onion in butter/oil until browned, 6–8 minutes; add garlic 30 seconds.
Add rice; toast 1 minute.
Pour in broth, pinch salt; simmer covered 12–15 minutes until tender.
Fold in spinach and parsley to wilt.
Season to taste.
Portion into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Top with sliced baked chicken.
recipes.notes: Great with a squeeze of lemon.

recipes.title: Broccoli-Cheddar Egg Muffins & Herbed Potatoes
steps: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss potatoes with 2 tbsp oil, herbs, salt; roast on a sheet 20–25 minutes.
Steam or microwave broccoli 2 minutes until crisp-tender.
Whisk eggs, milk, salt, pepper; fold in broccoli and cheddar; fill greased muffin tin.
Bake muffins at 375°F (190°C) for 14–16 minutes until set.
Portion potatoes and muffins into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve potatoes with sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken if desired.
recipes.notes: Breakfast or lunch; muffins keep 4 days refrigerated.

recipes.title: Harissa-Roasted Veg & Millet Bowls
steps: Cook millet in 4 cups salted water, 18–20 minutes; fluff.
Heat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Toss carrots, zucchini, onion with oil, harissa, salt; roast 18–20 minutes.
Portion millet and veg.
Add lemon wedge and yogurt if using.
Seal and chill.
recipes.chickenPair: Add baked chicken slices on top.
recipes.notes: Adjust harissa to heat preference.

recipes.title: Ginger-Garlic Veg Fried Rice with Cashews
steps: Scramble eggs in a large skillet with a little oil; set aside.
Stir-fry carrots in 1 tbsp oil 2 minutes; add peas, garlic, ginger 1 minute.
Add rice; cook, stirring, 3–4 minutes.
Stir in tamari and sesame oil; fold in eggs and green onions.
Top with cashews.
Portion into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced baked chicken for extra protein.
recipes.notes: Use day-old rice for best texture.

recipes.title: Tomato-Basil White Bean Gluten-Free Pasta
steps: Boil pasta in salted water until al dente; reserve 1/2 cup pasta water; drain.
Sauté garlic in oil 30 seconds; add tomatoes; cook 3–4 minutes until juicy.
Stir in beans and pasta; splash pasta water to loosen.
Fold in basil; season with salt, pepper, chili flakes.
Top with Parmesan.
Pack into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced baked chicken to each portion if desired.
recipes.notes: Toss with a drizzle of olive oil after reheating.

recipes.title: Red Lentil Dal with Quick Cucumber Raita
steps: Sauté onion in 1 tbsp oil until soft; add garlic, ginger, spices 30 seconds.
Add lentils, tomatoes, 4 cups water; simmer 12–15 minutes until soft.
Stir in coconut milk (or more water) and salt.
Mix yogurt with grated cucumber and pinch salt for raita.
Portion rice and dal into containers.
Top with cilantro; pack raita separately.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken on the side.
recipes.notes: Dal thickens as it cools; thin with water when reheating.

recipes.title: Sweet Corn & Zucchini Fritters with Avocado Salad
steps: Mix zucchini, corn, oat flour, eggs, green onions, salt, pepper into a thick batter.
Heat film of oil in skillet; cook 1/4-cup scoops 2–3 minutes per side until golden; repeat.
Toss avocado with lime and cilantro; season.
Cool fritters on rack.
Portion fritters and salad into containers.
Reheat fritters in a dry pan or oven.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced baked chicken alongside.
recipes.notes: Keep avocado salad separate until serving if packing for 3+ days.

recipes.title: Roasted Carrot & Beet Quinoa with Lemon-Tahini
steps: Heat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Toss carrots, beets, onion with 3 tbsp oil, salt, pepper; roast 20–22 minutes.
Cook quinoa in 4 cups salted water, 15 minutes; fluff.
Whisk tahini, lemon, garlic, water, pinch salt until pourable.
Portion quinoa and roasted veg; drizzle dressing.
Cool, then seal.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken.
recipes.notes: Add chopped parsley for freshness.

recipes.title: Thai Basil Veggie Stir-Fry with Jasmine Rice
steps: Cook rice in 5 cups water; rest covered.
Whisk tamari, lime, honey.
Stir-fry green beans and carrots in hot oil 3 minutes; add peppers 2 minutes.
Add garlic 30 seconds; pour sauce; toss.
Fold in basil off heat.
Portion over rice.
recipes.chickenPair: Top with sliced baked chicken if desired.
recipes.notes: Add chili flakes for heat.

recipes.title: Moroccan-Spiced Chickpea & Millet with Raisins
steps: Cook millet in 4 cups salted water, 18–20 minutes; fluff.
Sauté onion and carrots in oil 5 minutes.
Add spices; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in chickpeas and raisins; warm through; season.
Fold into millet with parsley.
Portion and cool.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken when serving.
recipes.notes: Finish with lemon for brightness.

recipes.title: Hearty Potato, Leek & Cannellini Skillet
steps: Pan-fry potatoes in 2 tbsp oil with pinch salt until golden, 10–12 minutes; push to sides.
Sauté leeks in 1 tbsp oil 3 minutes; add garlic 30 seconds.
Stir in beans, thyme, broth; simmer 3–4 minutes.
Add lemon juice; season.
Toss to combine.
Portion into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced baked chicken on the side.
recipes.notes: Great with chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Buckwheat (Kasha) Veg Bowls
steps: Toast buckwheat in a dry pot 1 minute; add 4 cups salted water; simmer 12–14 minutes; drain if needed; cool 5 minutes.
Whisk oil, lemon, salt, pepper.
Combine buckwheat, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, parsley; toss with dressing.
Fold in feta if using.
Portion into containers.
Chill.
recipes.chickenPair: Top with sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken if desired.
recipes.notes: Naturally gluten-free despite the name.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Buddha Bowls with Tahini-Lemon
steps: Cook grains in salted water per package (about 15 minutes for quinoa or 25 for quick brown); cool slightly.
Massage kale with 1 tbsp oil and pinch salt to soften.
Whisk tahini, lemon, garlic, water, salt.
Portion grains, kale, chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes.
Drizzle dressing over each.
Seal and chill.
recipes.chickenPair: Serve with sliced baked chicken on top.
recipes.notes: Add olives or feta if desired.

recipes.title: Deconstructed Quinoa Stuffed Peppers
steps: Cook quinoa in 4 cups salted water, 15 minutes; fluff.
Sauté onion and peppers in oil 5 minutes; add garlic 30 seconds.
Stir in tomatoes, cumin, paprika; simmer 3 minutes; season.
Fold in quinoa.
Top with cheese if using to melt briefly.
Portion into containers.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken when serving.
recipes.notes: Finish with chopped cilantro.

recipes.title: Savory Oats with Mushrooms, Spinach & Egg
steps: Simmer oats in broth 8–10 minutes, stirring; season with tamari and sesame oil.
Sauté mushrooms in olive oil until browned; season.
Stir spinach into hot oats to wilt.
Portion oats; top with mushrooms.
Add peeled jammy egg to each container.
Garnish with green onions.
recipes.chickenPair: Replace egg with sliced baked chicken if desired.
recipes.notes: Keep eggs separate if storing 4–5 days.

recipes.title: Sesame Crunch Cabbage & Rice Noodle Bowls
steps: Cook noodles per package; rinse cold and drain well.
Whisk lime juice, tamari, honey, oils.
Toss noodles with cabbage, carrots, cilantro, dressing.
Sprinkle sesame seeds.
Portion into containers.
Chill; add extra lime when serving.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced baked chicken to each bowl for protein.
recipes.notes: Rinse noodles to keep from sticking.

recipes.title: Crispy Potatoes & Veg with Herbed Yogurt
steps: Heat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Toss potatoes with 2 tbsp oil, paprika, salt; roast 10 minutes.
Add broccoli and peppers with 2 tbsp oil, garlic powder, salt, pepper; roast 12–15 minutes more.
Mix yogurt, lemon, herbs, pinch salt.
Portion veg and potatoes.
Serve with herbed yogurt dollop.
recipes.chickenPair: Add sliced salt-and-pepper baked chicken to each container.
recipes.notes: Crisp again in a hot oven for 5 minutes.
